draughts.model

Class PDN

  • java.lang.Object
    • draughts.model.PDN

  • public class PDN
extends java.lang.Object
    part of the MODEL component in a MVC pattern for this application

    PDN class - Manages PDN notation, which is the standard computer-processable format for recording draughts games. event : the name of the tournament or match event.

    site : the location of the event.
    This is in "City, Region COUNTRY" format, where COUNTRY is the 3-letter International Olympic Committee code for the country.
    An example is "New York City, NY USA".

    date : the starting date of the game, in YYYY.MM.DD form. "??" are used for unknown values. round : the playing round ordinal of the game. white : the player of the White pieces, in "last name, first name" format. black : the player of the Black pieces, same format as White.

    result : the result of the game.
    Possible values, depending on the type of result format : - DEFAULT : "1-0" (white won), "0-1" (black won), "1/2-1/2" (draw), or "*" (other, e.g., the game is ongoing).
    - INTERNATIONAL : "2-0" (white won), "0-2" (black won), "1-1" (draw), "0-0" (lost for both players), "*" (other, e.g., the game is ongoing).

    GameType : the type of the draughts game.
    Possible values:
    - INTERNATIONAL (20),
    - ENGLISH (21),
    - ITALIAN (22),
    - AMERICAN_POOL (23),
    - SPANISH (24),
    - RUSSIAN (25),
    - BRAZILIAN (26),
    - CANADIAN (27),
    - PORTUGUESE (28),
    - CZECH (29),
    - TURKISH (30),
    - THAI (31),
    - FRISIAN (40),
    - SPANTSIRETTI (41).
    Default value = INTERNATIONAL (20).

    FEN : the initial position of the draughts board.
    See the FEN class for more information.

    moveText : moveText contains the actual moves for the game.
    Moves begin with the source square number, then a "-" or "x", finally destination square number.
    Jumps must be specified by each square that would be jumped ("11x18x25"), or two squares only ("11x25").

    See Also:
    Wikipedia: Portable Draughts Notation, pdn.fmjd.org: PDN 3.0 standard

      • event

        public java.lang.String event
        event : the name of the tournament or match event.
        Default value = "?".

      • site

        public java.lang.String site
        site : the location of the event.
        This is in "City, Region COUNTRY" format, where COUNTRY is the 3-letter International Olympic Committee code for the country.
        An example is "New York City, NY USA".
        Default value = "?".

      • date

        public java.lang.String date
        date : the starting date of the game, in YYYY.MM.DD form.
        "??" are used for unknown values.
        Default value = "????.??.??".

      • round

        public java.lang.String round
        round : the playing round ordinal of the game.
        Default value = "?".

        public java.lang.String white
        white : the player of the White pieces, in "last name, first name" format.
        Default value = "?".

        black : the player of the Black pieces, same format as White.
        Default value = "?".

      • gameType

        public GameType gameType
        GameType : the type of the draughts game.
        Possible values: - INTERNATIONAL (20),
        - ENGLISH (21),
        - ITALIAN (22),
        - AMERICAN_POOL (23),
        - SPANISH (24),
        - RUSSIAN (25),
        - BRAZILIAN (26),
        - CANADIAN (27),
        - PORTUGUESE (28),
        - CZECH (29),
        - TURKISH (30),
        - THAI (31),
        - FRISIAN (40),
        - SPANTSIRETTI (41).
        Default value = INTERNATIONAL (20).

      • setup

        public java.lang.String setup
        setup : present if a setup (FEN field) is indicated.
        Default value = "".

      • fen

        public java.lang.String fen
        fen (optional) : the initial position on the checkers board.
        If absent, default position is loaded instead.
        See Also:
        pdn.fmjd.org/fen.html

      • result

        public java.lang.String result
        result : the result of the game.
        Possible values, depending on the type of result format : - DEFAULT : "1-0" (white won), "0-1" (black won), "1/2-1/2" (draw), or "*" (other, e.g., the game is ongoing).
        - INTERNATIONAL : "2-0" (white won), "0-2" (black won), "1-1" (draw), "0-0" (lost for both players), "*" (other, e.g., the game is ongoing).

      • moveText

        public java.lang.String moveText
        moveText : moveText contains the actual moves for the game.
        Moves begin with the source square number, then a "-" or "x", finally destination square number.
        Jumps must be specified by each square that would be jumped ("11x18x25"), or two squares only ("11x25").
        Preferred notation is explicit, specifying all captured squares.

    • Method Detail

      • parsePDNFile

        public static PDN parsePDNFile(java.io.File file)
        Parses a PDN file into a PDN object.
        Parameters:
        file - : file to parse
        Returns:
        a PDN object with read fields and corresponding values

      • parsePDNLine

        public static PDN parsePDNLine(java.lang.String line)
        Parses a single PDN line or string.
        Parameters:
        line - : a string containing the PDN field to be parsed.
        Event, Site, Date, Round, White, Black, Result and FEN fields should be enclosed in brackets like this:
        "[Site "Lyon, France, Europe, Earth, Solar System, Milky Way, Virgo Supercluster, Laniakea Supercluster, Observable Universe, Universe"]\r\n"
        MoveText is not enclosed into brackets [ ] or quotation marks " ".
        Returns:
        a PDN field with its value

      • getLabel

        public static java.lang.String getLabel(GameType gameType,
                                        int row,
                                        int col)
        Helper method returning the label of the corresponding square.
        Parameters:
        row - : the row number of the square.
        col - : the column number of the square.
        gameType - : the type of the game.
        pdnNotation is the notation format to use for the labeling. It is composed of:
        - a character indicating the notation type:
        - A = alpha/numeric like chess,
        - N = numeric like draughts.

        - followed by a number indicating the location of the first square (A1 or 1) from the perspective of the starting player:
        - 0 = Bottom left
        - 1 = Bottom right
        - 2 = Top left
        - 3 = Top right

        Returns:
        String, the label of this square.

      • addMove

        public void addMove(Move move)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This game formatted as a valid PDN string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A formatted PDN string describing this draughts game. Comments are currently not treated.
